ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY

Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: I don't have the knowledge to take a leadership role when it comes to achieving a total victory over anorexia
Notes: 5 = Strongly disagree; 4 = Disagree; 3 = Neither agree nor disagree; 2 = Agree; 1 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Parents cannot be seen as the solution in the treatment of anorexia until ways in which they have caused it have been properly explored
Notes: 5 = Strongly disagree; 4 = Disagree; 3 = Neither agree nor disagree; 2 = Agree; 1 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I feel equipped with specific practical strategies for the task of bring about the complete recovery of my child in the home setting
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Disagree; 3 = Neither agree nor disagree; 4 = Agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: It is not always advisable to get tough with a child with anorexia because he/she will experience too much trauma and distress
Notes: 5 = Strongly disagree; 4 = Disagree; 3 = Neither agree nor disagree; 2 = Agree; 1 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: My own parental instincts are a more reliable guide for the task of achieving the recovery of my child from anorexia than any expert advice I might receive from professionals
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Disagree; 3 = Neither agree nor disagree; 4 = Agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: While parents are important, children with anorexia will never get better until they receive some sort of individual therapy themselves
Notes: 5 = Strongly disagree; 4 = Disagree; 3 = Neither agree nor disagree; 2 = Agree; 1 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: It is more my responsibility than my child's to bring him/her to a healthy weight
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Disagree; 3 = Neither agree nor disagree; 4 = Agree; 5 = Strongly agree
Sum the responses to each item. A higher score indicates greater parent self-efficacy
1 = Screening; 2 = Baseline; 3 = Mid-way; 4 = One Month; 5 = Three Months; 6 = Final
